Asynchronous (asyncio) Client#

class natnet_py.AsyncClient#

This class describes a Natnet client.

Usage:

  1. Create the client

    >>> client = AsyncClient()

  2. Discover a server

    >>> servers = await client.discover(broadcast_address=255.255.255.255, timeout=1)

  3. and/or connect to a server directly

    >>> await client.connect(server_address=127.0.0.1)

  1. Read data

    >>> await client.get_data()

    or add a callback

    >>> client.data_callback = lambda time_ns, msg: print(time_ns, msg)

  2. and/or wait for some time or until disconnection

    >>> await client.wait(duration=60.0)

  3. close the connection

    >>> await client.unconnect()

  4. close the client

    >>> await client.close()
__init__(address: str = '0.0.0.0', command_port: int = 1510, queue: int = 10, logger: ~logging.Logger = <RootLogger root (WARNING)>, now: ~typing.Callable[[], int] = <built-in function time_ns>, sync: bool = True)#

Construct an instance

Parameters:

  • address – The IP4 address of the client. Leave to "0.0.0.0" to bind to all interfaces.

  • command_port – The port to send commands to.

  • queue – length of the incoming mocap messages queue

  • logger – the logger to use

  • now – a function used to stamp incoming messages

  • sync – whether to sync the client and server clocks upon connection

property can_change_bitstream_version: bool#

Whether the client may ask to change natnet protocol version.

Returns:

True if able to change bitstream version, False otherwise.

property can_subscribe: bool#

Determines ability to subscribe (which requires NatNet >= 4).

Returns:

True if able to subscribe, False otherwise.

async clear_subscriptions(timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Unsubscribe (requires NatNet >= 4)

Parameters:

timeout – The request timeout

Returns:

True if successful

async close() → None#

Closes the client connections.

async connect(discovery_address: str = '', server_address: str = '127.0.0.1', timeout: float = 5.0, start_listening_for_data: bool = True) → bool#

Connect to a server. If the broadcast address is configured, it will first try to discover reachable NatNet servers in the network.

Parameters:

  • discovery_address – The IP4 broadcast address where servers announce themselves. If not set, it will not perform auto-discovery.

  • server_address – The IP4 address of the NatNet server. Only used if auto-discovery is not performed.

  • timeout – the timeout for the server to be discovered and for it to accept connection.

  • start_listening_for_data – whether to start listening for incoming mocap data. If not set, we can trigger this later using start_listening_for_data().

Once a server connects, the client automatically requires an updated description, and updates rigid_bodies_names.

Returns:

True if successful

property connected: bool#

Whether a NatNet server is connected.

Returns:

True if connected else False

property data_port: int#

The configured data port

Returns:

The server actual port or the default port

property description: MoCapDescription | None#

The connected mocap description

async disable_asset(name: bytes, timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Disables the asset.

Parameters:

  • name – The name of the asset

  • timeout – The timeout for the request

Returns:

True if successful

async discover(broadcast_address: str, number: int = -1, timeout: float = 5.0) → dict[tuple[str, int], ServerInfo]#

Discover Motive Natnet servers

Parameters:

  • broadcast_address – The IPv4 broadcast address to announce this client

  • timeout – The maximal time to wait to discover enough services

  • number – The maximal number of services to discover. It will return after the first maximal_number servers are discovered.

Returns:

A dictionary of server information keyed by server address.

async enable_asset(name: bytes, timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Enables the asset.

Parameters:

  • name – The name of the asset

  • timeout – The timeout for the request

Returns:

True if successful

async get_data(timeout: float = 0.0, last: bool = False) → tuple[int, MoCapData] | None#

Gets mocap data.

Parameters:

  • timeout – The timeout

  • last – whether to ignore the queue and fetch only the last data

Returns:

The (receiving stamp in ns, data) or None if not available

async get_framerate() → float | None#

Gets the framerate.

Returns:

The framerate in Hz or None if the request was not successful

property multicast_address: str#

The server IP4 multicast address

Returns:

An IP4 address

property server_address: tuple[str, int] | None#

The IP4 address and port of the connected server

Returns:

(IP4 address, port) or None if not connected

property server_info: ServerInfo | None#

The connected server

server_ticks_to_client_ns_time(ticks: int) → int#

Convert a server ticks to a time synchronized with the client clock

Parameters:

ticks – The ticks

Returns:

The time as nanoseconds since epoch

async set_framerate(rate: int, timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Sets the framerate.

Parameters:

  • rate – The desired framerate

  • timeout – The timeout for the request

Returns:

True if successful

async set_version(major: int, minor: int) → bool#

Sets the protocol version.

Parameters:

  • major – The major version number

  • minor – The minor version number

Returns:

True if successful

async start_listening_for_data(timeout: float = 5.0) → bool#

Starts a listening for data.

Parameters:

timeout – The request timeout

Returns:

True if successful

async subscribe(kind: bytes = b'RigidBody', name: bytes = b'', id: int = 0, timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Subscribe (requires NatNet >= 4)

Parameters:

  • kind – The type of the asset

  • name – The name of the asset

  • id – The id of the asset

  • timeout – The request timeout

Returns:

True if successful

async subscribe_all(timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Subscribe (requires NatNet >= 4) to all rigid bodies

Parameters:

timeout – The request timeout

Returns:

True if successful

async unconnect() → None#

Unconnect the currently connected server

Returns:

True if successful

async unsubscribe(name: bytes = b'', id: int = 0, timeout: float = 0.0) → bool#

Unsubscribe (requires NatNet >= 4) from a rigid body updates

Parameters:

  • name – The name of the asset

  • id – The id of the asset

  • timeout – The request timeout

Returns:

True if successful

async update_description(timeout: float = 0.0) → None#

Require a new description from the connected server

Automatically called after connecting a server.

property use_multicast: bool#

Whether the server is using multicasting to stream data

Returns:

True if multicasting

async wait(duration: float) → bool#

Wait a given duration or until the client has disconnected.

Parameters:

duration – The duration to wait for

Returns:

True if still connected
